mcq_data.question_content: 14 An object is suspended by two ropes. One rope has a tension of 410 N at an angle of 60 to the horizontal. The other rope has a tension of 210 N at an angle of 10 to the horizontal.  ropes 10� 60� 410 N 210 N object   The object is in equilibrium.  What is the mass of the object?
18 A lamp is switched on for 2.0 hours. The power input to the lamp is 1.0 W. The energy given out by the lamp as light is 7.0  103 J.  How much energy is converted to other forms by the lamp?
20 A known tensile force acts on a metal wire. The wire does not exceed its limit of proportionality.  Which two measurements enable the strain of the wire to be calculated?

options.A: the unstretched length of the wire and the cross-sectional area of the wire
options.B: the unstretched length of the wire and the extension of the wire
options.C: the Young modulus of the metal and the extension of the wire
options.D: the Young modulus of the metal and the unstretched length of the wire

mcq_data.question_content: 21 A wire is extended by different forces. The wire obeys Hooke’s law.
31 A nichrome wire has a resistance of 15  and a diameter of 3.0 mm. The number density of the free electrons in nichrome is 9.0  1028 m–3.

options.A: The resistance of the lamp decreases because the temperature decreases.
options.B: The resistance of the lamp decreases because the temperature increases.
options.C: The resistance of the lamp increases because the temperature decreases.
options.D: The resistance of the lamp increases because the temperature increases.

mcq_data.question_content: 34 A metal wire has resistance R.  The wire is stretched so that its diameter decreases to 94.0% of the original diameter.  The volume of the wire is unchanged.  What is the resistance of the stretched wire?

37 A potential divider circuit is designed to detect the difference in temperature between two different places.  V X Y 20 mV   The cell has electromotive force (e.m.f.) 20 mV and negligible internal resistance.  Initially, thermistors X and Y are at the same temperature and have the same resistance. The voltmeter reads 10 mV. X is then placed in a cold environment and its resistance doubles. Y is placed in a warm environment and its resistance halves.  What is the new reading on the voltmeter?
